intro: Trichanthecium auricomum, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences, resembling small cups. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Trichanthecium auricomum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
